You are my wife. In return for the love I have for you, I have taken all your wishes and my love for you, and have inherited the property as per Schedule, free of charge, and I have full and undisputed rights over it. The R.C.C. Daba house and premises as per the following Schedule are hereby deeded to you free of charge and the property is hereby transferred to you as per the above mentioned deed. Therefore, you are the absolute rightful owner of the Scheduled Property and have all the rights of donation and sale and you should enjoy it freely from generation to generation, paying the Panchayat taxes. If any disputes arise regarding the Scheduled Property from anyone, I will handle them on my own responsibility and ensure that the Scheduled Property is administered to you without any interruption. Although you and your heirs have rights over this property, I and my heirs do not have any rights. From now on, I will not have any disputes with you, your heirs, or my heirs regarding this property. I have not made any encumbrances on the Scheduled Property to anyone and I have written this settlement deed in your name. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 396 of 2026, dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Patta Anil in favour of his wife Talluri Sneha Latha, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 163.059 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 1-13, comprised in survey number 40/1A, Assessment No. 13 (Old) or 234741000013 (New), L.P No. 1486, situated in Gundlapalli Village & Panchayat, Maddipadu Mandal, within the District of Bapatla registered at sub-registrar office Addanki is bounded as follows: North by: Gunji Chalapathi Rao Property South by: Patta Koteswara Rao Property East by: Panchayathi Road West by: Sidda Raghavarao Property
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
